question_1.text: Is <image> a single, simple photo taken with a camera, with no other visual or textual elements added to it?
What is depicted in the image?

multichoice_1.label: person
multichoice_1.description: <image>'s main element is one or more people

multichoice_2.label: object
multichoice_2.description: <image>'s main element is an object or a thing

multichoice_3.label: environment
multichoice_3.description: <image>'s main element is a place or a setting

multichoice_4.label: event
multichoice_4.description: <image>'s main element is an event or an activity

multichoice_5.label: document
multichoice_5.description: <image>'s main element is a document or a piece of text

question_1.text: Is <image> composed of multiple independent images, each representing a separate claim or a part of a claim?
What is the type of the image?

multichoice_1.label: meme
multichoice_1.description: <image> is a meme, typically humorous, combining text and visuals to convey a message or joke.

multichoice_2.label: interface
multichoice_2.description: <image> is an interface, such as a user interface or a graphical user interface, showing how a system, software, or application looks, including menues, windows, etc.

multichoice_3.label: annotated_image
multichoice_3.description: <image> is an annotated image -- image overlayed with visual elements such as arrows, highlights, etc. to provide context or explanation.

multichoice_4.label: screenshot
multichoice_4.description: <image> is a screenshot, capturing a moment from a digital screen, such as a website, app, or video.

multichoice_5.label: document
multichoice_5.description: <image> is a document, such as a scanned page, a PDF, an email, or a digital file that mainly contains text.

multichoice_6.label: computer_graphic_or_art
multichoice_6.description: <image> is a computer graphic or art, created using digital tools or software, such as a digital painting, 3D rendering, or graphic design.

multichoice_7.label: infographic
multichoice_7.description: <image> is an infographic, combining text and visuals to convey information, such as a map, graph, plot, etc.

multichoice_8.label: Collage
multichoice_8.description: <image> is a collage, combining multiple images or elements into a single composition.

question_2.text: What type of emotion does the image evoke?

question_1.text: What is the main positive emotion conveyed in the image?

multichoice_3.label: pride
multichoice_3.description: <image> conveys pride in oneself or others, or a sense of accomplishment.

multichoice_5.label: other_positive_emotion
multichoice_5.description: <image> conveys another positive emotion not listed above.

question_1.text: What is the main negative emotion conveyed in the image?

multichoice_5.label: other_negative_emotion
multichoice_5.description: <image> conveys another negative emotion not listed above.

question_3.text: What is the framing of <image>, i.e., the topical association that the image evoke?

multichoice_1.label: morality
multichoice_1.description: Any perspective—or policy objective or action (including proposed action)—that is compelled by religious doctrine or interpretation, duty, honor, righteousness or any other sense of ethics or social responsibility.

multichoice_2.label: fairness_and_equality
multichoice_2.description: Equality or inequality with which laws, punishment, rewards, and resources are applied or distributed among individuals or groups. Also the balance between the rights or interests of one individual or group compared to another individual or group.

multichoice_3.label: constitutionality_and_jurisprudence
multichoice_3.description: The constraints imposed on or freedoms granted to individuals, government, and corporations via the Constitution, Bill of Rights and other amendments, or judicial interpretation. This deals specifically with the authority of government to regulate, and the authority of individuals/corporations to act independently of government.

multichoice_4.label: policy_prescription_and_evaluation
multichoice_4.description: Particular policies proposed for addressing an identified problem, and figuring out if certain policies will work, or if existing policies are effective.

multichoice_5.label: law_and_order_crime_and_justice
multichoice_5.description: Specific policies in practice and their enforcement, incentives, and implications. Includes stories about enforcement and interpretation of laws by individuals and law enforcement, breaking laws, loopholes, fines, sentencing and punishment. Increases or reductions in crime.

multichoice_6.label: security_and_defence
multichoice_6.description: Security, threats to security, and protection of one’s person, family, in-group, nation, etc. Generally an action or a call to action that can be taken to protect the welfare of a person, group, nation sometimes from a not yet manifested threat.

multichoice_7.label: health_and_safety
multichoice_7.description: Healthcare access and effectiveness, illness, disease, sanitation, obesity, mental health effects, prevention of or perpetuation of gun violence, infrastructure and building safety.

multichoice_8.label: quality_of_life
multichoice_8.description: The effects of a policy on individuals’ wealth, mobility, access to resources, happiness, social structures, ease of day-to-day routines, quality of community life etc.

multichoice_9.label: cultural_identity
multichoice_9.description: The social norms, trends, values and customs constituting culture(s), as they relate to a specific policy issue.

multichoice_10.label: public_opinion
multichoice_10.description: References to general social attitudes, polling and demographic information, as well as implied or actual consequences of diverging from or getting ahead of public opinion or polls.

multichoice_11.label: political
multichoice_11.description: Any political considerations surrounding an issue. Issue actions or efforts or stances that are political, such as partisan filibusters, lobbyist involvement, bipartisan efforts, deal-making and vote trading, appealing to one’s base, mentions of political manoeuvring. Explicit statements that a policy issue is good or bad for a particular political party.

multichoice_12.label: external_regulation_and_reputation
multichoice_12.description: The United States’ external relations with another nation; the external relations of one state with another; or relations between groups. This includes trade agreements and outcomes, comparisons of policy outcomes or desired policy outcomes.

multichoice_13.label: capacity_and_resources
multichoice_13.description: The lack of or availability of physical, geographical, spatial, human, and financial resources, or the capacity of existing systems and resources to implement or carry out policy goals.

multichoice_14.label: economic
multichoice_14.description: The costs, benefits, or monetary/financial implications of the issue (to an individual, family, community or to the economy as a whole).

multichoice_15.label: other_frame
multichoice_15.description: Any frames that do not fit into the above categories.

question_4.text: Does <image> help understanding or contextualizing the claim in <post>?

question_1.text: Does <image> contextualize the claim in <post> with concrete real-world examples and scenarios?
Does <image> represent elements within the text of <post> in the form of a living being, making the claim feels more personal?
Does <image> contain a concrete example of a broader claim?
Does <image> contain a visualization to support or explain the claim in <post>?
Does  <image> contain a high-detailed visualization, in the form of graphs, maps, and charts?
Does the image contain A simple illustration to assist the reader in understanding the claim?

question_5.text: Was <image> digitally manipulated or manufactured, i.e., edited or is completely faked?

question_1.text: Is <image> completely fabricated? i.e, not based on a real image, but rather made from scratch?
Is <image> AI-generated?
Does <image> contains a forged document?
Is <image> staged?
Was <image> digitally altered?
in which way was <image> digitally altered?

multichoice_1.label: addition
multichoice_1.description: Fake details were added to the image using digital means, such as Photoshop.

multichoice_2.label: removal
multichoice_2.description: Real details details were erased or removed from the image, e.g., using cropping.

multichoice_3.label: replacement
multichoice_3.description: Entire entities or elements in the image were replaced with different, fake ones.

multichoice_4.label: textual
multichoice_4.description: Some text in the image was edited or added.

multichoice_5.label: edit
multichoice_5.description: The image was edited in some other means, e.g., changing the facial expression of a person or adding a filter.

question_1.text: Is <image> staged?

answer_2.question: Is there an issue with the source or credibility of <image>? i.e., does <image> or <post> come from a satirical, parodical, or otherwise unreliable source, or from and imposter account?

question_1.text: Does <image> come from a clearly satirical or parodical source?
Does <image> come from an imposter account, i.e., an account that pretends to be someone else?
Is there an issue with the way the text in <post> describes the image or relates to it?
Does the claim in <post> deny the authenticity of the image, even though <image> is real and authentic?

answer_2.text: no, no such claim was made.

question_1.text: Does the claim in <post> wrongly describe an element in or an attribute of <image>?
Does the claim in <post> wrongly describe a metadata attribute of <image>?
which metadata attribute is wrongly described?

multichoice_1.label: time_mismatch
multichoice_1.description: The date when <image> was taken or created.

multichoice_2.label: place_mismatch
multichoice_2.description: The location where <image> was taken or created.

question_1.text: Does the claim in <post> wrongly describes what is being depict in <image>?
What type of mismatch is it? What element is being describe wrongly?

multichoice_1.label: identity_mismatch
multichoice_1.description: <post> incorrectly names an entity in <image>, such as a person, a brand, or an object.

multichoice_2.label: event_mismatch
multichoice_2.description: There is a discrepancy between regarding the event depicted in <image> and the textual description in <post>. (e.g., a concert is described as a protest)

question_1.text: Does the claim in <post> misinterpret the image or desctibe it in a misleading way?
In which way does <post> misinterpret <image>?

multichoice_1.label: over_underestimation_of_severity
multichoice_1.description: the text in <post> misinterprets the severity of what is depicted in <image>.

multichoice_2.label: misinterpretation_of_consequences
multichoice_2.description: <post> contains a false or misleading claim regarding the consequences of what is depicted in <image>.

multichoice_3.label: over_underestimation_of_frequency
multichoice_3.description: <post> misinterprets the frequency/uniqueness of the event depicted in <image>.

multichoice_4.label: scientific_errors_or_conspiracies
multichoice_4.description: <post> contains a false scientific claim not grounded in scientific evidence, or promotes a known conspiracy theory.

multichoice_5.label: misinterpretation_of_relevance
multichoice_5.description: <post> misinterprets the relevance of <image> to some other event, i.e., falsly claiming that it is relevant

multichoice_6.label: slanted_representation
multichoice_6.description: <post> omits other types of important context.

multichoice_7.label: other_misinterpretation_or_misleading_representation
multichoice_7.description: <post> descibes <image> in a different misleading way.

question_1.text: Does <post> make scientific errors or promote conspiracies?
Does the claim in <post> omit important relevant information?
